page.title: 05RELIGION, EAST BARKWITH
page.content: {Methodism}used to be very strong in this area. There have been three chapels in{East Barkwith}and one in {South Willingham.}Two of the chapels in East Barkwith are dated 1860, that is shortly after the split in Methodism. They are both brick, with slate roofs. One is now used as a garage, the other is a dwelling house, and has been restored, and covered with pink pebble-dash. The third chapel is also brick and slate, it is dated 1925, and has numerous stone blocks with the names of people who donated towards the building. It is also a private house. The chapel in South Willingham is dated 1834, and is built of brick and slate. It has recently been converted to a private house.
